value: The Supreme Court of India has recently issued an order banning tourism and related activities in core areas of tiger reserves. In Bandipur, all of the park is designated as core zone, and as a result, tourism activities, including resort stays without safaris may not be conducted. Guests at resorts have been ordered to vacate immediately, and no further bookings will be undertaken. The Supreme Court will review the case on the 22nd of August, 2012, however, no change in the order is expected, and tourism in Bandipur, along with Nagarhole, Mudumalai, BR Hills and other tiger reserves across the country, is expected to cease permanently.

content= Thrillophilia arranges for wildlife and camping tours around Bandipur which includes rappelling, camping, trekking (outside forest area), jumering, river crossing and quad biking. Sep – May is the best season for most of the adventure activities.

Monkeys do cause some menace here if one is not careful. One has to make sure they don't leave their cottage doors and windows open when you go out. If you are driving by and see some wildlife, do not lower your windshield when you stop your car, you'll have attracted some fearless monkeys which will enter your vehicle and not leave until it finds something to eat. Try not to feed the animals.
